contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[Image:Sieradz Voivodship 1975.png|thumb|right|200px|Sieradz Voivodeship 1975-1998]] '''Sieradz Voivodeship''' ({{Lang-pl|województwo sieradzkie}}) was a unit of administrative division and local government in [[Poland]] in the years 1975–1998, superseded by [[Łódź Voivodeship]]. ==1975-1998== <br>Capital city: [[Sieradz]] <br> <br>Major cities and towns: (population in 1995): * [[Zduńska Wola]] (45,900); * [[Sieradz]] (44,700); * [[Wieluń]] (25,500); * [[Łask]] (20,200). See also: * [[Voivodeships of Poland]] ==1772-1795== {{Details|Sieradz Voivodeship (1772-1795)}} '''Sieradz Voivodeship''' was a unit of administrative division and local government in Poland from 14th century to the partitions of Poland in 1772–1795. It was a part of [[Greater Poland]] province. {{coord missing|Poland}} [[Category:Former voivodeships of Poland (1975–1998)]] {{poland-geo-stub}}
